intro: Verbascum omanense, commonly known as the Oman mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are broad and covered in soft, woolly hairs, which help reduce water loss. Verbascum omanense is often found in rocky soils and is a common sight in the mountainous regions of Oman.
